Module ntnu.idatt1002
Package ntnu.idatt1002.dao

Class CategoryDAO

java.lang.Object
ntnu.idatt1002.dao.CategoryDAO
public final class CategoryDAO
extends java.lang.Object
The class CategoryDAO provides static methods for handling categories for a User. In the storage system categories are folders either in the 'Categories' directory, or inside a project directory created by ProjectDAO. Under each category folder all Task objects with the corresponding category and project variables are stored.

  • Constructor Details

    • CategoryDAO

      public CategoryDAO()

  • Method Details

    • list

      public static java.lang.String[] list​(java.lang.String username)
      Returns a String[] of all normal categories under a User folder. Categories inside projects are not included in this method.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      Returns:
      an array of categories. Returns null if folder is empty.

    • list

      public static java.lang.String[] list​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String project)
      Returns a String[] of all categories under a project folder.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      project - the project folder under a User.
      Returns:
      an array of categories. Returns null if folder is empty.

    • add

      public static boolean add​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String category)
      Add a new category to a User. This folder will be created under the 'Categories' folder.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      category - the name of the new category.
      Returns:
      True if succesfull. False if directory could not be created. Either the user doesn't exist or a folder with the given name already exists.

    • add

      public static boolean add​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String project, java.lang.String category)
      Add a new category to a project. This folder will be created under the project folder which again is stored under 'Projects'.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      project - the name of the project.
      category - the name of the new category.
      Returns:
      True if succesfull. False if directory could not be created. Either the user doesn't exist, the project doesn't exist, or a folder with the given name already exists.

    • deleteByUser

      public static boolean deleteByUser​(java.lang.String username)
      Delete all regular categories inside a User. This will empty the 'Categories' folder and all Task files within. Categories inside projects will not be deleted.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      Returns:
      True if succesfull. False if some or all elements failed to delete, normally if the user doesn't exist.

    • deleteByProject

      public static boolean deleteByProject​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String project)
      Delete all cateogies in a project folder. This will also delete all Task files within.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      project - the name of the project.
      Returns:
      True if succesfull. False if some or all elements failed to delete. Either the user or the project doesn't exist.

    • delete

      public static boolean delete​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String category)
      Delete a single category in a User folder with all Task files within.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      category - the name of the category to delete.
      Returns:
      True if succesfull. False if some or all elements failed to delete. Either the user or the category doesn't exist.

    • delete

      public static boolean delete​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String project, java.lang.String category)
      Delete a single category in a project folder with all Task files within.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      project - the name of the project.
      category - the name of the category to delete.
      Returns:
      True if succesfull. False if some or all elements failed to delete. Either the user, the project, or the category doesn't exist.
